author: James Hider
title: Biden issues order targeting Israeli settlers who attack West Bank Palestinians | KNKX Public Radio
text: Biden issues order targeting Israeli settlers who attack West Bank Palestinians Updated February 1, 2024 at 4:37 PM ET President Biden issued an executive order on Thursday targeting Israeli settlers in the West Bank who have been attacking Palestinians in the occupied territory. The order named four people and will lay the groundwork for financial sanctions against settlers who carry out violent assaults, which have increased since Hamas launched an attack on Israel three months ago, triggering a full-scale war in Gaza. The order will not target U.S. citizens, who make up a significant number of the settler community. The Biden administration had issued an order late last year imposing travel bans on Israeli settlers who had attacked Palestinians. While only four people are named, the order marks the first time that the U.S. has targeted Israeli settlers with the threat of frozen assets and bank accounts in an attempt to rein in settler attacks on Palestinians living in the West Bank, which Palestinians see as the central plank of a future Palestinian state. "This violence poses a grave threat to peace, security, and stability in the West Bank, Israel, and the Middle East region, and threatens the national security and foreign policy interests of the United States," White House national security adviser Jake Sullivan said in a statement. There have been almost 500 attacks by settlers on Palestinians in the West Bank, which is largely under Israeli-military occupation, since the start of the Israel-Hamas war in Gaza, according to the United Nations. Some Palestinians have been killed in these attacks while settlers have also attacked property and torched cars, the Palestinian authorities and human right groups say. Three of the four men named in Thursday's executive order have been prosecuted by Israeli authorities, State Department spokesperson Matthew Miller told reporters on Thursday. One of the four men cited in the order, Shalom Zicherman, was indicted by Israeli police on assault and damage charges in 2022, after he was filmed attacking left-wing Israeli activists near Hebron, in the southern West Bank, as they traveled to join a demonstration in protest at Palestinians being evicted from their homes, [according to the Israeli newspaper Haaretz.](https://www.haaretz.com/israel-news/2022-06-20/ty-article/.premium/israeli-settler-indicted-for-throwing-stones-at-left-wing-activists/ 181-800a-da88-afef-d5cee72b0000) Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu responded to the announcement on Thursday, saying, "Israel acts against all those who break the law everywhere, and therefore there is no room for exceptional measures in this regard." But Dror Etkes, an Israeli expert in settler violence, welcomed the news. "The fact that these people are walking free and they are in the West Bank and can do what they want to do is an indication that the law enforcement system in Israel... prefers not to deal with this type of people," he told NPR. "This is why we came to the point that the American administration is, you know, is sanctioning them," he said, adding that all four had been "involved in severe violent attacks against Palestinians." Israel's Finance Minister Bezalel Smotrich, who himself lives in a settlement in the West Bank, [said on X, formerly known as Twitter](https://twitter.com/bezalelsm/status/1753093343507005858?s=46), that "the 'settler violence campaign is an anti-Semitic lie spread by Israel's enemies with the aim of discrediting the pioneer settlers." Copyright 2024 NPR. To see more, visit https://www.npr.org.

author: paula
title: Winter Weather Advisory in place for Lake Tahoe Friday - Saturday
text: SOUTH LAKE TAHOE, Calif. - The National Weather Service (NWS) in Reno has issued a Winter Weather Advisory for the Greater Lake Tahoe area from 5 pm. Friday to 5 p.m. Saturday. NWS Reno said to expect snow accumulations up to 4 inches below 7000 feet with an inch or so at Lake Level, and 4 and 8 inches above 7000 feet. Winds gusting as high as 50 mph over Sierra ridges. IMPACTS - Plan on slippery road conditions. The hazardous conditions could impact the Friday evening commute. Gusty winds could bring down tree branches. ADDITIONAL DETAILS - Gusty winds and waves up to 3 feet may lead to hazardous boating conditions on Lake Tahoe. The NWS Reno weekend forecast for South Lake Tahoe: Friday - Mostly sunny, with a high near 52. Southwest wind 5 to 10 mph, with gusts as high as 20 mph. Friday Night - Snow, mainly after 11 pm. Low around 28. Southwest wind 5 to 10 mph. The chance of precipitation is 90%. A new snow accumulation of around an inch is possible. Saturday - Snow before 11 am, then a chance of rain. High near 46. West wind around 5 mph. The chance of precipitation is 90%. New snow accumulation of less than a half inch is possible. Saturday Night - Snow likely, mainly before 11 pm. Mostly cloudy, with a low of around 19. West wind around 5 mph becoming calm in the evening. The chance of precipitation is 60%. Little or no snow accumulation is expected. Sunday - A 20 percent chance of snow before 11 am. Mostly sunny, with a high near 43. Light north wind becoming northeast 5 to 10 mph in the afternoon.

title: Liverpool vira sobre o Leicester e aumenta vantagem na Premier League - ESPN
text:
O [Liverpool](/futebol/time/_/id/364) Ã© cada vez mais lÃ­der da [Premier League](/futebol/liga/_/nome/eng.1/premier-league)! No encerramento do Boxing Day, os Reds tomaram susto, mas venceram o [Leicester City](/futebol/time/_/id/375) de virada por 3 a 1 em Anfield nesta quinta-feira (26).
Com a derrota do [Chelsea](/futebol/time/_/id/363), a equipe de Arne Slot pode encerrar a rodada com, no mÃ­nimo, seis pontos de vantagem para o vice-lÃ­der, a depender do resultado do jogo do [Arsenal](/futebol/time/_/id/359/arsenal) na sexta (27).
O Leicester, por sua vez, volta para a zona de rebaixamento depois de ser ultrapassado pelo [Wolverhampton](/futebol/time/_/id/380/wolverhampton-wanderers), que venceu o [Manchester United](/futebol/time/_/id/360/manchester-united).
Apesar de sair atrÃ¡s, o time da casa foi dominante do inÃ­cio ao fim. Logo aos 3 minutos, Salah recebeu cruzamento na medida e cabeceou no cantinho, mas Stolarczyk fez bela defesa.
Dois minutos depois, porÃ©m, Mavididi cruzou rasteio na Ã¡rea, Ayew, que se antecipou a Robertson, girou e chutou rasteiro para abrir o placar.
Dali em diante, a partida parecia ter apenas um time podendo atacar, com o Liverpool colocando duas bolas na trave e sofrendo para vencer Stolarczyk.
AtÃ© que, aos 45, Cody Gakpo recebeu pela esquerda, cortou para o meio e chutou cruzado no cantinho para, enfim, empatar o jogo.
Na volta para o segundo tempo, logo aos 3 minutos, a pressÃ£o seguiu, Mac Allister cruzou rasteiro na Ã¡rea, e Curtis Jones chegou desviando para as redes, virando o marcador.
Aos 22, o terceiro saiu com Cody Gakpo, mas o lance foi anulado apÃ³s longa anÃ¡lise do VAR por impedimento de Darwin NÃºÃ±ez.
Mas nÃ£o tardou muito para a rede balanÃ§ar mais uma vez. Aos 36, Salah recebeu na ponta direita, invadiu a Ã¡rea e bateu cruzado no cantinho para deixar o seu.

Leicester: 18Âº lugar, com 14 pontos

author: @WOWT6News
title: Papillion restaurant suffers under the heat of a broken AC
text:
Papillion restaurant suffers under the heat of a broken AC
OMAHA, Neb. (WOWT) - A popular Papillion restaurant is losing business because of the heat and humidity over the past month.
One wonders why since it doesnâ€™t have outside seating.
Fovero Greek Restaurant remains open because it has a lot of fans, which help customers endure the inside temperature.
â€œItâ€™s going up. I can feel it. So it will be very steamy. Thatâ€™s why we came early,â€ said customer Deb Wieczorek.
Since renting the restaurant space two years ago, Lori Long said sheâ€™s been experiencing the hottes summer yet, but not in the cash register.
â€œLast week, closing three days early and losing thousands of dollars in sales - customers leaving because itâ€™s too hot to eat in here,â€ Long said.
Instead of a fork, customer Judy Oâ€™Conner picks up a thermometer.
â€œI see 85 degrees right now,â€ she said.
The staff keeps the food hot while trying to cool the restaurant.
For the noon lunch crowd, the thermostat stays cool on 71 degrees. But the actual temperature in the business reads 84 degrees and will climb.
The temperature reached 93 degrees Tuesday evening, which forced the manager to make the last open hour take-out only.
â€œI need the air conditioning and whether itâ€™s what the management company says, the hood, or whatever, reconditioned air, I need something that will cool the space for everyone,â€ Long said.
Long said the landlord brought in HVAC experts who estimated repairs at $36,000 but she canâ€™t afford to pay any of that cost.
Jennifer Thompson set up a GoFundMe site for the restaurantâ€™s daily operating expenses and to raise awareness of the air conditioning issue.
â€œThe hope would be that the landlord takes responsibility if it their responsibility, and also to help with some emergency relief keeping staff paid and doors open,â€ Thompson said.
The 16 mostly part-time restaurant workers arenâ€™t leaving, except for a break.
â€œItâ€™s been where I have to go home and sleep for a while to work off the heat in front of a fan and take cold showers,â€ said server Shannon Sharman.
â€œThis is (Longâ€™s) dream, so I want to see it succeed,â€ Oâ€™Conner said.
Long said owning a restaurant is in her blood, but customersâ€™ sweat has brought her to tears.
â€œIf this continues, I canâ€™t financially succeed,â€ Long said.
Wednesday night, Long had to close early again as the indoor temperature reached 97 degrees before 5 p.m.
The lack of adequate cooling in the restaurant ahs forced Long to close early a total of more than 20 hours over six days in June. She estimated that cost her at least $5,000 in revenue.
First Alert 6 left a message for the buildingâ€™s owner in North Dakota but has yet to receive a response from them or the strip mall manager.
Copyright 2025 WOWT. All rights reserved.

author: Lissette Monterrosa
title: "He pasado mÃ¡s tiempo en hospitales que en mi casa": joven que lucha contra el cÃ¡ncer
text:
A sus 25 aÃ±os, Adriana Alexandra Catota SÃ¡nchez enfrenta una de las batallas mÃ¡s difÃ­ciles de su vida: el cÃ¡ncer de tiroides. Graduada en DiseÃ±o GrÃ¡fico Publicitario, Alexandra ha visto cÃ³mo su vida laboral, personal y emocional ha sido trastocada por una enfermedad que hoy amenaza su salud y su futuro.
Todo comenzÃ³ en 2022, cuando fue diagnosticada con hipertiroidismo de difÃ­cil control. A pesar de recibir tratamientos con altas dosis de medicamentos â€”hasta 10 pastillas diariasâ€”, su cuerpo no respondÃ­a favorablemente.
En medio de mÃºltiples exÃ¡menes y visitas mÃ©dicas, se detectÃ³ un nÃ³dulo tiroideo, es decir, una masa o protuberancia anormal ubicada dentro de la glÃ¡ndula tiroides, localizada en el cuello. Este fue clasificado como TIRADS (Thyroid Imaging Reporting and Data System), nivel 4, lo que indica un riesgo moderado de malignidad. AdemÃ¡s, se le diagnosticÃ³ tiroiditis de Hashimoto, una enfermedad autoinmune en la que el sistema inmunolÃ³gico ataca por error la glÃ¡ndula tiroides, causando inflamaciÃ³n y daÃ±o progresivo a sus cÃ©lulas. Esto provoca sÃ­ntomas como fatiga constante, depresiÃ³n, caÃ­da del cabello, ritmo cardÃ­aco lento, problemas de memoria o concentraciÃ³n e irregularidades menstruales.
Por ello, los mÃ©dicos le recomendaron una tiroidectomÃ­a casi total, una cirugÃ­a en la que se extrae la mayor parte de la glÃ¡ndula tiroides, dejando solo una pequeÃ±a porciÃ³n de tejido para reducir el riesgo de daÃ±ar estructuras cercanas.
Desde entonces, su vida cambiÃ³ por completo. â€œHe pasado mÃ¡s tiempo en hospitales y clÃ­nicas que en mi casaâ€, cuenta. Esta condiciÃ³n de salud la obligÃ³ a dejar oportunidades laborales y a posponer su solicitud de graduaciÃ³n, la cual logrÃ³ completar reciÃ©n en 2024. â€œSe me dificultÃ³ mucho mantener un empleo. Cada vez que intentaba regresar a trabajar, me preguntaban por quÃ© habÃ­a estado inactiva tanto tiempo. Incluso, en un proceso de contrataciÃ³n me rechazaron porque reportÃ© que estaba por operarmeâ€, relata.
Pero el golpe mÃ¡s duro llegÃ³ despuÃ©s de la cirugÃ­a: el resultado de la biopsia fue devastador. Se confirmÃ³ que se trataba de cÃ¡ncer de tiroides. Ahora, Alexandra debe someterse a una segunda intervenciÃ³n quirÃºrgica para extraer completamente lo que queda de la glÃ¡ndula, seguida de una terapia con yodo radiactivo, un tratamiento complejo y costoso que representa su Ãºnica esperanza de recuperaciÃ³n.
El procedimiento se realizarÃ¡ en la Ãºnica clÃ­nica del paÃ­s que ofrece este tipo de atenciÃ³n especializada. Antes de recibir la terapia, deberÃ¡ seguir una dieta estricta libre de yodo, realizarse estudios de TSH (hormona estimulante de la tiroides) y aplicarse inyecciones especÃ­ficas, las cuales tambiÃ©n representan un alto costo.
A esto se suman citas mÃ©dicas, medicamentos, estudios de control y traslados constantes desde MetapÃ¡n hasta San Salvador. â€œSolo los gastos de transporte y alimentaciÃ³n por consulta rondan entre $60 y $80. A veces mi papÃ¡ me lleva en carro; otras veces me toca pagar Uber en San Salvadorâ€, explica.
Alexandra estima que necesita entre $8,000 y $10,000 dÃ³lares para cubrir todo el tratamiento, incluidos exÃ¡menes, medicamentos y la terapia radiactiva. Por ello ha iniciado una campaÃ±a en GoFundMe, confiando en la solidaridad de quienes puedan sumarse a su causa. Cada aporte, sin importar el monto, representa una oportunidad para seguir adelante.
â€œNo ha sido fÃ¡cil. Me he visto afectada tambiÃ©n emocionalmente por todo este proceso. Pero sigo luchando con la esperanza de sanar. Hoy, mÃ¡s que nunca, necesito el apoyo de todosâ€, expresa con profunda gratitud.
CÃ“MO AYUDAR
Las personas interesadas en apoyar pueden hacerlo a travÃ©s del siguiente enlace:
ðŸ”— https://acortar.link/BG89NV
ADRIANA CATOTA, Cuenta de Ahorro Banco AgrÃ­cola 3760829818
alexandra.catota009@gmail.com
TambiÃ©n pueden contactar vÃ­a WhatsApp al +503 7298 0724 para mÃ¡s informaciÃ³n o conocer otras formas de apoyo.

author: Scott Jennings
title: Eric Bieniemy Presser: Sam Howell didnâ€™t play well; we werenâ€™t playing well as a team
text: Washington Commanders Assistant Head Coach/Offensive Coordinator Eric Bieniemy spoke to the media before todayâ€™s practice. Ron Rivera named Jacoby Brissett the starting QB for this Sundayâ€™s home game against the San Francisco 49ers. Brissett has replaced Sam Howell the last two weeks due to poor play, and now heâ€™ll get his first start for Washington. Bieniemy said that Howell wasnâ€™t playing well, and they werenâ€™t playing well as a team. Howell has done some good things this season, but he wanted him to have to opportunity to watch Brissett run the offense for a full game. He said Howell gets a reset. and Brissett earned the right to play. Bieniemy was asked about his own responsibility in Howellâ€™s development, and his regression as the season has gone on. He said he is constantly evaluating his own playcalling, and all aspects of his coaching. He also said that the coaches put their trust in the players to execute the plays, and Howell wasnâ€™t playing up to their expectations. Eric Bieniemy LIVE: Asst HC/OC Eric Bieniemy speaks to the media before practiceâ€” Washington Commanders (@Commanders) [https://t.co/FUEXO5zCgx] [December 28, 2023] Jacoby Brissett replacing Sam Howell at QB: Eric Bieniemy is at the mic now. Started off by addressing Jacoby getting the start this week. Thought it would be a good idea for Howell to get a reset, but also Jacoby earned the right to playâ€” Zach Selby (@ZachSelbyWC) [December 28, 2023] Bieniemy: Howell sitting will give him time to reflect and observe how Brissett handles being the starterâ€” Zach Selby (@ZachSelbyWC) [December 28, 2023] Good Afternoon. I know that you all are aware of the decisions that have taken place, after a number of conversations, sitting down with all the different coaches on our staff, weâ€™ve decided to make the move. Obviously, we thought itâ€™d be good for Sam to hit the reset button, but also understand that Jacoby has earned a right to be placed in this position so he can go out there and earn the right to play. But when itâ€™s all said and done with, we just wanted to do what was best for the team moving forward. With that said, Iâ€™m all ears. Biggest difference in Brissett leading the offense compared to Howell: Itâ€™s a number of things. Obviously, we werenâ€™t playing well as a team, and sometimes you just need a spark. Sam did a number of great things throughout the entire season. Obviously, thereâ€™s a number of things that take place throughout the course of a game, but unfortunately the quarterback position is the most scrutinized position in all of football. So, you just basically evaluate everything. And with a veteran like Jacoby, whoâ€™s been in this game for a while and whoâ€™s the ultimate professional, he stepped in and I thought he rose to the occasion and he gave us life, and he gave us a spark. So, with all that taking place, we just had to basically, carefully consider and just make that decision moving forward. Sam Howell: Eric Bieniemy on Sam Howell: "He just didn't play well, and unfortunately that happens. It's not like anything you can put your finger on."â€” Nicki Jhabvala (@NickiJhabvala) [December 28, 2023] l thought Sam did a great job. Obviously, the production has not spoken well for itself, but heâ€™s done a great job. Heâ€™s a professional, heâ€™s a young kid growing in this industry, and Iâ€™ll say that sometimes without any bad luck, you wouldnâ€™t have any good luck at all. This is going to give him an opportunity to reflect on everything that has taken place so far this season. On top of that, heâ€™s going to have an opportunity to watch a veteran like Jacoby work, and I think thatâ€™s probably one of the best things that he can do. The good thing is that, obviously, heâ€™s healthy, but now he can just sit back and observe, really slow everything down. But, he canâ€™t slow everything down too, too much because he always got to be ready on any play. But I just think right now itâ€™s good for him. But also too, itâ€™s a great opportunity for Jacoby moving forward. Offensive performance: More from Eric Bieniemy on Commanders offensive performance: "The QB situation is the most scrutinized in all of football but collectively we got to be better as a group. I got to do a better job."â€” JP Finlay (@JPFinlayNBCS) [December 28, 2023] l think itâ€™s a number of things. Like I said, the quarterback position is probably the most scrutinized position in all of football, but collectively, we got to play better as a group. That means I got to do a better job, guys got to do a better job of executing and playing, and we got to go out and making sure that we are doing everything under the sun thatâ€™s going to give us the best opportunity to have success. He just didnâ€™t play well. And unfortunately, you know, that happens and itâ€™s not like anything that you can put your finger on. But on the flip side of that, Jacoby steps in and he sparks a rally. So, the good thing is that you have a great quarterback room, and those guys do a great job of supporting one another. Those guys are the biggest fans of each other. And obviously itâ€™s a tough situation, but I guarantee you Sam is going to be Jacobyâ€™s biggest fan, just as Jacoby was his biggest fan moving forward. How Howell can put himself back in the mix: l think what he needs to do is just to slow the process down, be a film junkie, and keep asking questions, keep taking notes. Like I said, Sam has been the ultimate professional. I think right now it just gives him an opportunity to observe. One of the best things that he can do, more than anything, is not so much everything I just said, but just watch a veteran who has done it before. Weâ€™ve talked about this in the past when Jacoby has stepped in, just to see how he operates, how he handles the team, how he basically takes command of the huddle or certain things that are said. Also, thereâ€™s certain things that we canâ€™t teach as coaches that he can gravitate to as far as work ethic and all the little inside things that those quarterbacks do to help them to maintain their stability throughout the entire season. So, thereâ€™s a number of things that comes to mind. But, like I said, Jacoby has this opportunity and Iâ€™m excited about him moving forward. Chris Rodriguez Jr.â€™s injuryâ€™s impact on what they are able to do: Well, Iâ€™ll just say this. Those guys are going to do a heck of a job. Coach Randy Jordan and Coach JK, Jennifer King. They do a great job. We got a great running back room. Those guys, they do a great job of working well together. So, weâ€™re not concerned about that. The next man will step up and rise to the occasion. What impresses him about the San Francisco 49ers: l mean, what doesnâ€™t impress you about what they do? First of all, they do an outstanding job on defense. Obviously, Steve Wilks is the defensive coordinator who Iâ€™ve known for a number of years. In fact, I think me and Steve probably came out the same year in the draft, or maybe he came out one year later. But, Iâ€™ve known Steve for a long time. He does a great job. With all that said, everything starts up front, Bosa is doing a hell of a job, and then we get to see our old pal Chase come back. Obviously, they got one of the better backers in all the football. And thatâ€™s not to disrespect anybody else on that team, itâ€™s just that I have a connection with my man Fred Warner. His dad, my younger brother, they basically were very close friends. So, Iâ€™ve followed Fredâ€™s career for a number of years now, and then thereâ€™s a corner whoâ€™s playing for the San Francisco 49ers who was on our team, who won the Super Bowl with the Kansas City Chiefs when we were there. So, Iâ€™m very aware of who they are and what they bring to the table. Itâ€™s going to be a great challenge for us. When itâ€™s all said and done, we just need to come out and execute. We got to go play hard. We got to play assignment sound, and we got to be accountable to one another by making sure that we are executing our jobs with great attention to detail. Kansas City Chiefs disappointing season: l have not had an opportunity to watch. I know everybody probably wants to know that, but Christmas, I actually enjoy Christmas being home with the family and being present with my family. I didnâ€™t watch any football, which actually kind of felt good. I canâ€™t believe that I, and I admitted that. Has he gone a whole day without watching football before?: We had the day off. So, I did get some work done, but I didnâ€™t watch any live television games. It felt good because you donâ€™t put yourself in that stressful position because you find yourself becoming a fan regardless of whoâ€™s playing. And so, no, I enjoyed Christmas with my family, and I appreciate Coach Rivera giving us that opportunity to have the day off, to spend that important time with the ones who that you care for. Chase Young saying he will treat it like any other game and why he expects from him: Oh, yeah, Chase, he going to treat it like, weâ€™ll see his best effort. I say that, I havenâ€™t had an opportunity to know him as long as everybody else. First of all, I love the kid. I love the energy that he brings. Obviously, heâ€™s been a tremendous player. This league is the way it is. And I mean it is the ultimate professional game, and sometimes those things happen, but I expect him to be at his best. That means that we have to be at our best as well. These guys know each other. Theyâ€™ve had an opportunity to practice against each other for a number of years. This entire offseason weâ€™ve had an opportunity to just work against him. So, I expect Chase to be at his best, but I also expect our guys to be at their best also, because theyâ€™re very much aware of what he can do and what a game wrecker he can be as well. Chris Rodriguez Jr.â€™s performance this season: You know what, Iâ€™m fired up and excited about the kid. The kid, Chris is a very, very smart, hardworking, intelligent football player. He does whatever you ask him to do. If you want him to go out there and cover a kick, heâ€™s going to cover a kick. If you want him to basically line up on punt return and block the right guard, thatâ€™s what heâ€™s going to do. If you want to line him up on kickoff return as an up back, thatâ€™s what heâ€™s going to do. So, you love everything that he brings to the table because he does not take anything for granted. And then when given an opportunity to go out there and produce and play his normal position, he understands what that means. Thatâ€™s an opportunity to put something on tape, but itâ€™s also an opportunity to show exactly what heâ€™s capable of doing. So, love the kid. I thought he did a tremendous job. Obviously, we donâ€™t discuss anything with injuries, but I will say this, the kid, heâ€™s going to be great for this organization moving forward. Anything he could have done to prevent Howellâ€™s recent regression: Oh, every game I sit back and I go back and I watch tape. There are always things that you would like to do or like to change and thatâ€™s the case for every game and in every practice. So, youâ€™re always self-evaluating first because you have to take a look in the mirror. But one thing that Iâ€™ve learned as well is I have to put trust in the players to go out there and be at their best. Now, thatâ€™s unfortunate that he didnâ€™t play up to the level that we would have loved him to play. But one thing I will say about that kid, that kid is a very, very resilient kid. Heâ€™s very professional. Iâ€™m very proud of him. Heâ€™s accomplished a lot. I know right now this is a reset moment for him, but Sam has a bright future. He has a great career ahead of him and Iâ€™m just looking forward to watching him to continue to grow. If making Howell the backup helps or hurts his confidence over letting him play: Well, I mean, you can make a case, you can make an argument for both ways, correct? I think sometimes you got to learn how to play through these moments. But also too, when you have a veteran whoâ€™s done a great job of stepping in and has sparked some energy moving forward, but also causes some excitement, you canâ€™t overlook that. So yes, you want to be very mindful of Samâ€™s confidence level and how heâ€™s going to handle this, but also too, weâ€™re in the profession, right? Production-driven industry: Truth from EB about the NFL: "We're in a profession that's a production driven industry."â€” JP Finlay (@JPFinlayNBCS) [December 28, 2023] Itâ€™s a production driven industry. So, Jacobyâ€™s done a heck of a job. So now weâ€™re going to give Jacoby this opportunity to go out there and show what he can do. The best thing about that is that those guys are both professionals, theyâ€™re great friends, and Sam is going to be his biggest supporter, and heâ€™s also going to be his biggest fan. So those are the things that excite me about this. What he could have done better in helping Howell develop this season: Well, thereâ€™s always things. I mean, youâ€™re going back, youâ€™re always thinking about calls that could have been made because as a play caller, youâ€™re always evaluating, did I make the right call? Did we get the right coverage? Did we get the right look? Did we have the right concept? Did we get the exact defense? So thatâ€™s always something that you are always going to consider. But those are the things and it ainâ€™t so much that it is thinking just about the quarterback, itâ€™s more about overall offensively when youâ€™re addressing that, making sure that weâ€™re putting the guys in the right positions to go out there and have the success that they need to have. But you got to understand, when you wear this hat, youâ€™re always going basically look in the mirror, because you always want to evaluate what youâ€™re doing so you can help self to be better moving forward. How much the quarterback change was about the rest of the team: You always have to consider, I mean, this is a team sport. We got to make sure that we are doing what is right, not just for the team, but also to what is best for the organization. And right now, this is whatâ€™s best.

author: Valley City Times-Record
title: Leading Provider of Innovative Beverage Pasteurization Solutions, Prowm, Revolutionizes the Industry | User | times-online.com
text:
Milwaukee, WI - Pro Engineering / Manufacturing Inc. is a leading provider of innovative beverage pasteurization solutions, is pleased to announce the compelling advantages of their state-of-the-art Tunnel and Batch Pasteurizers for co-packing companies looking to enhance their operations.
In today's competitive co-packing industry, quality and efficiency are paramount. With consumers demanding fresher, safer, and more consistently delicious products, co-packing companies are continually seeking ways to meet these expectations. Pro Engineering / Manufacturing Inc. has recognized this need and developed a range of cutting-edge Tunnel and Batch Pasteurizers that offer unparalleled benefits for co-packers.
Pro Engineering / Manufacturing Inc.'s Tunnel Pasteurizers are designed to heat-treat a wide range of beverages including beer, tea, coffee, hard seltzers and more. These systems ensure that products maintain their quality, taste, and nutritional value while meeting the strictest safety standards. Tunnel Pasteurizers from Pro Engineering / Manufacturing Inc. enable co-packing companies to:
Enhance Product Safety: The precise temperature control in Tunnel Pasteurizers eliminates harmful microorganisms, ensuring products are safe for consumers, meet regulatory requirements, and extends shelf life. Improve Quality: Maintaining product quality and taste is crucial. Our pasteurizers achieve this by minimizing the thermal impact on sensitive products, preserving their freshness and flavor. Boost Efficiency: With Pro Engineering / Manufacturing Inc.'s Tunnel Pasteurizers, co-packers can increase their production throughput while reducing labor costs. These systems are designed for optimal efficiency. Expand Product Portfolio: Co-packing companies can diversify their offerings by confidently pasteurizing various products, including those with different packaging formats. In addition to Tunnel Pasteurizers, Pro Engineering / Manufacturing Inc. offers Batch Pasteurizers, which are ideal for smaller batch sizes and specialized products. These versatile systems provide co-packers with the flexibility to experiment with new recipes, develop seasonal items, and cater to niche markets, all while maintaining quality and safety.
Since 1977, Pro Engineering / Manufacturing Inc. has had a long-standing reputation for delivering robust, reliable, and innovative customized beverage equipment. Their Tunnel and Batch Pasteurizers are no exception. Co-packing companies seeking to stay competitive, meet consumer demands, and expand their product offerings should consider partnering with Pro to implement these advanced pasteurization solutions.
For more information about Pro Engineering / Manufacturing Inc. and their Tunnel and Batch Pasteurizers, please visit: https://prowm.com/co-packing-companies-expanding-new-tunnel-batch-pasteurizer/
About Pro:
Pro Engineering / Manufacturing Inc. is a trusted provider of beverage pasteurizers and solutions, specializing in pasteurization systems, conveyor systems, and more. With a commitment to innovation, quality, and customer satisfaction, Pro has been a preferred partner for companies in the beverage industry for since 1977.
